intro: Chaenorhinum crassifolium subsp. pityusicum, commonly known as the Canary Island hairpin, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh, arid conditions of its native habitat. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and ecological traits compared to other members of the Chaenorhinum genus.
